import { Link } from 'gatsby'
import { FiInfo } from 'react-icons/fi'
import { Counter, LikeButton } from '../../components/Complete'
import { GatsbyImage, getImage } from 'gatsby-plugin-image'

<!--- (make sure to set up embeddedImages query in post-template (dynamically generated file for mdx -- see gatsby.node.js)) -->
<!--- Better set up than clashing with gatsby-remark-plugin which generates error (i.e when attached with gatsby-plugin-mdx) -->

<GatsbyImage image={getImage(props.embeddedImages[0])} alt="random stuff" className="first-inline-img" />

## My first mdx file

<h2> React Components </h2>

<Counter />

```jsx
import React from "react"

import styled from "styled-components"
import { AiOutlineLike } from "react-icons/ai"
const LikeButton = () => {
  const [value, setValue] = React.useState(0)
  return (
    <Wrapper>
      <div>
        <button onClick={() => setValue(value + 1)}>
          <AiOutlineLike />
        </button>
        <p>
          Liked the post?
          <br />
          Click thumbs up few times
        </p>
      </div>
      <span>+{value}</span>
    </Wrapper>
  )
}
```

<LikeButton />
